Over the decades, Trump's company has developed hotels, golf courses, and other properties across the United States and the world. He also gained international recognition for his role as the host of the reality TV show "The Apprentice," which aired from 2004 to 2015.

Trump's political career began in the 1980s, when he sought the Republican nomination for President in 1988 and 2000, though he was unsuccessful in both endeavors. In 2015, Trump announced his candidacy for President in the 2016 election. Despite his lack of political experience, Trump managed to win the Republican primaries and eventually secured the party's nomination. He went on to defeat Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton in the 2016 general election, becoming the first President in U.S. history to serve without prior political experience.

As President, Trump's policy agenda focused on immigration, tax reform, and deregulation. He signed the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act in 2017, which lowered individual and corporate tax rates. Trump also signed the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) to replace the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) and implemented a controversial policy that led to the travel ban on several predominantly Muslim countries.
